IX.iii.1.C.3.g
.
Year of Exclusion
Deductible expenses can be applied against income received for the year during which the expenses are actually paid by the beneficiary.
Example
:  A Veteran’s child died in 2005.  The child was in the surviving spouse’s custody and the surviving spouse paid for the child’s funeral in 2006.  The amount paid in 2006 can be deducted from 2006 income for the purpose of keeping calendar year 2006 IVAP within the income limit and preserving the surviving spouse’s continued entitlement to Section 306 Pension.
title: M21-1, Part IX, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section C - Section 306 Pension and Old-Law Pension
